title: Helen Yemm: my Japanese acer has outgrown its pot, the best grey-leaved tree, insects that love roses
text:
HOUDINI ROOTS

We moved house years ago taking with us an Acer palmatum in a lovely pot. We stood it on a patch of gravel near the house while we decided on the best place for it. Time passed and when we tried to move it, we discovered to our horror that a major root had found its way out of the bottom of the pot and into the ground.

More time passed and the pot eventually cracked, giving us a dilemma. Dare we risk just cutting off the root and moving the tree? It could stay in situ since my husband says he can build a wooden “container” which we could back-fill with ericaceous compost. But it would need to be pruned – when and how?

Peter and Judith – via email
